item.title: Tips for an active classroom
item.description: Many instructors believe that learning is enhanced in a classroom where students are active participants rather than the passive recipients of a lecture. This document describes some general techniques for fostering an active classroom that can be used in a wide range of lesson topics. (There are also tips for specific topics included in the instructor guide for each topic.) item.title: A Workbook for Statistical Inference
item.description: A key concept in statistics is variability. This concept is really nothing more than the idea that individual objects or events differ from one another. For instance, the monthly cost of personal transportation (car, bus, biking, etc.) obvious varies from one person to another; some people spend a lot on transportation, some very little. Common sense says that some of the variability can be explained or accounted for by factors that can themselves be measured.
